title: Oxfordshire Live: Monday 28 November - BBC News
summary: work on an underground pipe which will share water and electricity between two hospitals in headington begins .
stonor park to open its doors to members of the public for the first time at christmas in its 850-year history .
a lack of morale among prison officers at hmp bullingdon may lead to rise in violence - report .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for reading today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with more news , sport , weather and travel from around oxfordshire .

documents.title: oxford to cambridge expressway plan has 'great merit '
text: transport minister andrew jones has been speaking to bbc radio oxford about plans for an oxford to cambridge expressway .
last week the government announced £ 27m pounds to fund work to create business case .
he said the government had a `` significant amount '' of unallocated budget to pay for `` viable '' local schemes .
we think an oxford to cambridge expressway would be of great merit this is a corridor within our country of significant , rapid , economic growth .
author: BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: travel update : traffic heavy after accident
text: there is severe congestion in the city centre on iffley road , the plain , st clements and marston road following the accident earlier on st aldates .
author: BBC Travel

text: oxford scuba club marks 60th anniversary

documents.title: disruption after woman hit by coach
text: st aldates has been closed again in both directions following the collision between an x90 coach and an elderly woman this afternoon .
city centre : severe congestion and delays over 45mins on the # iffley road inbound to the plain .
lengthy delays from st clement , # london rd

documents.title: terminally-ill man 's friends raise £ 54k
text: terminally-ill man 's friends raise £ 54k

documents.title: city centre coach incident latest
text: south central ambulance service has said the women hit by the coach in st aldates in oxford city centre has sustained serious leg injuries , and has been taken to the john radcliffe hospital .
meanwhile , st aldates has now been partially reopened following the collision involving the x90 coach and a pedestrian .

documents.title: south weather
text: south weather

documents.title: police : elderly woman believed to have serious injuries
text: an elderly women is believed to have sustained serious injuries after a collision involving a pedestrian and a coach in high street oxford , thames valley police says .
one southbound lane towards abingdon road has been closed while police investigate .
ambulance and fire services are also on the scene .

documents.title: pedestrian involved in 'incident ' with coach
text: oxford bus company says one of its coaches was involved in an incident with a female pedestrian on the high st in oxford .
we are currently working closely with the emergency services , with the wellbeing of the pedestrian being our utmost priority .
a full investigation into all the circumstances surrounding the incident will take place as a matter of urgency .

documents.title: oxford bus company report 'incident ' in city centre
text: due to an incident , high street and st.aldates are currently closed in both directions .
- i heard this was due to a coach collision with a lady any ideas/updates as to whether the lady is alright ?
unfortunately , no information at present .
will the 8 and 400 to headington divert on the same route ?
and can i get on them at their castle street stops ?
hi becca , yes you can board these services on castle st and they will be diverted via abingdon rd .
brilliant thank you !
this will cause major disruption on our services .
thank you for your patience .
how is this affecting x90 services ?
all services likely to be delayed .
hello !
please could you tell me where to catch the 300 back to redbridge if st aldates is closed ?
thank you .
hi chloe , you can catch the bus by the police station .
ok thanks
all traffic will divert via abingdon road/donnington bridge/iffley road to reach their destinations .

documents.title: two taken to hospital in head-on crash
text: two people had to be taken to hospital after being cut-out of their car in a head-on collision .
the crash happened at 17.06 on saturday between drayton and abingdon , one person suffered serious injuries and another two suffered minor injuries .

the cause of the crash is currently being investigated and abingdon fire station 's neil priestley said : `` this is one of many serious road traffic collisions we have recently attended and i would like to stress the importance of paying due care and attention . ''

documents.title: anglo-saxon coins in watlington part of 82,000 public archeological finds
text: a hoard of anglo-saxon coins discovered by an amateur metal detectorist was one of 82,272 archeological discoveries made by the public last year .
the british museum announced the number of nationwide finds in its portable antiquities scheme .
the hoard was buried near watlington around the end of the 870s , in the time of the `` last kingdom '' .
this was when the anglo-saxon kingdoms of mercia and wessex were fighting for their survival from the threat of the vikings , which was to lead to the unification of england .
the find was made by 60-year-old james mather in october 2015 .

documents.title: candle causes carterton bedroom fire
text: an unattended candle caused a bedroom fire at a house in acacia avenue , carterton , at about 16:30 on sunday .
four firefighters wearing breathing apparatus entered the property and used a high-pressure hose reel to put out the fire , which was limited to one bedroom .
the occupier of the house was alerted to the blaze when she heard her smoke alarm , quickly left the property and called 999 .

crew manager nathan crockford said : this is the second candle-related incident oxfordshire fire and rescue service have dealt with this weekend , and is a timely reminder of the need to observe candle safety and to extinguish them if you leave a room . ''

documents.title: 'dangerous ' road to upgraded
text: money is to be spent making the a361 in north oxfordshire safer .
a 21-mile stretch of the road between chipping norton and banbury is the most dangerous in the county , according to the department for transport , and one of the worst in the south east .
the government has announced it will fund the upgrade as part of £ 175m on the 50 most dangerous roads in the country .

documents.title: scuba club celebrates 60th birthday
text: an oxford scuba club , whose members helped raise the mary rose , is celebrating a landmark birthday .
oxford sub-aqua club says it was among the first british sub-aqua club ( bsac ) clubs to be formed .
the club 's founder , ann symonds , died last month aged 92 and will be remembered with a dive in a lake in snowdonia later this month .
sixty years ago , there were only a very small number of people diving we have of guys stepping into the reservoir in oxford in their woolly jumpers .
today of course , we 're very well equipped . ''

documents.title: hospital pipeline work starts again
text: hospital pipeline work starts again

documents.title: pensioner in life-threatening condition after cycling into vehicle
text: a pensioner is in a life-threatening condition after she cycled into a stationary van .
the 79-year-old woman hit a grey ford transit van on common road in witney at around 11.45 on friday .
she is being treated at the john radcliffe hospital and police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: rise in jail violence 'after staff cuts '
text: rise in jail violence 'after staff cuts '

documents.title: staff shortage has caused violence increase in hmp bullingdon , report claims
text: staff shortages are damaging morale and may have caused a rise in violence at hmp bullingdon , a report has said .
the prison 's independent monitoring board ( imb ) said `` indiscipline and violence have increased noticeably '' since 2013 cutbacks .
it also said the `` serious shortcomings '' of contractor carillion were having a substantial impact .
the ministry of justice said it is recruiting 2,500 extra officers across the prison system .

documents.title: pipeline work starts again
text: work on a multi-million pound project linking two oxford hospitals by pipeline has started for a second time .
contractors began to dig a trench in january 2016 only to fill it days later when told they lacked the right permissions .
the pipe will transfer energy between the john radcliffe and churchill hospitals and is designed to cut bills .
county councillor ,
roz smith , said : `` we are going to have some delays '' and it would clash access to headington work .

documents.title: lights and action
text: it was oxford 's christmas light festival.over the weekend .
and it kicked off the with lantern parade

documents.title: bryan adams to headline cornbury festival
text: forget the summer of 69 , it 's the summer of 2017 that 'll be remembered in oxfordshire as bryan adams will headline the last ever cornbury festival .
director of the festival hugh phillimore said he had been pestering the canadian rocker for more than 20 years , but said it would be well worth the wait .

documents.title: tea light burns down toilet
text: a tea light left on a toilet cistern started a fire at a flat in blackbird leys , oxford , on saturday morning .
fire crews arrived at the property in warburg crescent at 05.02 to put out the fire .
a fire alarm was fitted in the flat but was n't working .
the slade fire station manager gary d'anger said : `` the heat from the base of these candles caused the plastic cistern lid to ignite and then spread to other parts of the bathroom .
`` a smoke alarm had been fitted into the building but was n't working .
this type of incident highlights the dangers of inappropriately placed and unattended candles . ''

documents.title: blenheim lights up
text: blenheim palace launched its inaugural lights trail this weekend .
it trails through the capability brown-landscaped parkland , in woodstock , with highlights including a fairy-lit arbour and a scented fire garden .
it runs until 2 january .

documents.title: today 's weather : plenty of sunshine but breezy
text: we 're going to have a lovely few days with some fine weather , but it 's going to be a bit breezy .
the day may start out cloudy but that will quickly clear and we should have sunshine all day with highs of 7c

documents.title: let 's get this week started
text: good morning one and all and welcome to monday 's oxfordshire live page coming to you from bbc oxford towers in summertown .
we 'll be bringing you a veritable smorgasbord of news , sport , travel and weather throughout the day .
do n't forget to share your photos from across the county via email for this week 's oxfordshire 's big picture .
reader tim turan has kicked off proceedings with this lovely snap from bagley woods .
author: Alex Regan
South Online
